Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: rēx meus et Deus meus. ^ Hearken to the voice of my prayer
O Lord: O my King and my God.

Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: Domine; manē exaudiēs vōcem meam. ^ For to thee will I pray; O Lord
O Lord: in the morning thou shalt hear my voice.

Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: quoniam nōn Deus volens inīquitātem tū es. ^ In the morning I will stand before thee
to my words: because thou art not a God that willest iniquity.

Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: neque permanēbunt injūstī ante oculōs tuōs. ^ Neither shall the wicked dwell near thee
O Lord: nor shall the unjust abide before thy eyes.

2 ^ Verba mea auribus percipe: 7 ^ Ōdistī omnēs quī operantur inīquitātem; perdēs omnēs
Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: quī loquuntur mendācium. Virum sanguinum et dolōsum abōminābitur Dominus. ^ Thou hatest all the workers of iniquity; thou wilt destroy all that speak a lie. The bloody and the deceitful man the Lord will abhor.

2 ^ Verba mea auribus percipe: 8 ^ Egō autem in multitūdine misericordiae tuae
Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: introībō in domum tuam; adōrābō ad templum sānctum tuum in timōre tuō. ^ But as for me in the multitude of thy mercy
O Lord: I will come into thy house; I will worship towards thy holy temple

Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: dēdūc mē in jūstitiā tuā; propter inimīcōs meōs dīrige in conspectū tuō viam meam. ^ Conduct me
to my words: in thy justice; because of my enemies
direct my way in thy sight.

2 ^ Verba mea auribus percipe: 10 ^ Quoniam nōn est in ōre eōrum vēritās; cor eōrum vānum est. ^ For there is no truth in their mouth; their heart is vain.
11 ^ Sepulchrum patens est guttur eōrum; linguīs suīs dolōsē agēbant; jūdicā illōs
Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: Deus. Dēcidant ā cōgitātiōnibus suīs; secundum multitūdinem impietātum eōrum expelle eōs
to my words: Domine. ^ Their throat is an open sepulchre; they dealt deceitfully with their tongues; judge them
O God. Let them fall from their devices; according to the multitude of their wickednesses cast them out

2 ^ Verba mea auribus percipe: 12 ^ Et laetentur omnēs quī spērant in tē; in aeternum exsultābunt
Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: et habitābis in eīs. Et glōriābuntur in tē omnēs
to my words: ^ But let all them be glad that hope in thee; they shall rejoice for ever
and thou shalt dwell in them. And all they that love thy name shall glory in thee

Domine; intellege clāmōrem meum. ^ Give: ut scūtō bonae voluntātis tuae corōnāvistī nōs. ^ for thou wilt bless the just. O Lord
O Lord: thou hast crowned us as with a shield of thy good will.
